item.title: The Game Awards To Stream On Amazon Prime
item.content:encoded:
The Game Awards continue to grow, and have a new broadcast partner to show for it. Show creator and host Geoff Keighly announced on Tuesday that The Game Awards 2025 will stream on Amazon Prime Video for the first time.

In addition to being on Prime, The Game Awards will continue to stream on YouTube, Twitch, and other platforms.

Speaking with Variety about the news, Keighly said that the fact it‚Äôs an additional platform instead of a replacement makes it a ‚Äúreally exciting‚Äù addition for the show.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had lots of conversations with people over the years, and we‚Äôre like, there‚Äôs no way, there‚Äôs no world where we could ever really take the show off YouTube and Twitch ‚Äî where it was born back in 2014,‚Äù he said.

Keighly also said that despite being on a large platform like Prime Video, it won‚Äôt change how the show is produced and air. He also said that Amazon was receptive about a non-exclusive deal with the show.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important people know it doesn‚Äôt change our show at all,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre still making the same show. I came out of a life of working on television networks. And you had television folks that would give opinions and things on what you want the show to be.

‚ÄúThis is still The Game Awards. It‚Äôs the exact same show. They‚Äôre really just another distribution outlet, and they‚Äôre really letting us build the show the way we always do. We‚Äôre not changing anything about the show to accommodate a new platform.‚Äù

As mentioned, The Game Awards 2025 will air on Twitch and YouTube like always. On Twitch, however, another first will happen as the show will air in 2K. There will also be Twitch Drops for those watching on the platform.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 5 Trailer Officially Reveals Rogue and Gambit
item.content:encoded:
Players already knew that Rogue and Gambit are coming to Marvel Rivals Season 5, but a new trailer has made it official.

Marvel Rivals Season 5 is something players have been looking forward to a lot, especially after knowing which two characters will be taking the center stage in the new season. Rogue and Gambit were already revealed through several leaks and an advertisement on TikTok. Now, players have received an official trailer, providing a background for the upcoming season‚Äôs plot.

Marvel Rivals Rogue and Gambit Revealed Through New Trailer

The official X account (formerly Twitter) for Marvel Rivals teased yesterday that something new was coming with an invitation to Rogue and Gambit‚Äôs wedding. This invitation was followed by a new trailer, where we see the duo gearing up to tie the knot; however, their plans are met with an unforeseen roadblock as a timestream entanglement tears their world apart before Gambit and Rogue can say ‚ÄúI do‚Äù on Krakoa.

However, Gambit will not let this go so easily and will set forth on a ‚Äúdaring cosmic heist to steal the universe‚Äôs rarest ring ‚Äì and win back the moment time itself stole from them.‚Äù The new trailer offers no gameplay details or abilities for the upcoming characters; instead, it features a cinematic video that primarily sets up the narrative for the next season, ‚ÄúLove is a Battlefield‚Äù. Marvel Rivals Season 5 is set to release on November 14, 2025, and we can expect to receive more details about the two characters leading up to this date.

In other news, Marvel Rivals‚Äô PvE Zombies mode helped provide a major player spike on Steam recently. Additionally, Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra has been delayed to late 2026. item.title: Death Stranding 2‚Äôs Exoskeleton Releases Next Month
item.content:encoded:
You can purchase and wear the Exoskeleton from Death Stranding 2 starting in December 2025; however, limited stock is available.

As players wait for Death Stranding to reach new mediums, with A24 set to tell an original story, and another animated film in the works as well, players can look forward to something tangible in the coming months. Kojima Productions has partnered with Dnsys to bring a co-branded DS2 Exoskeleton, and here‚Äôs all you need to know about it.

Death Stranding 2 Exoskeleton Works Similar to the Ones in the Game

The collaboration between Kojima Productions and Dnsys for the Death Stranding 2: On the Beach limited edition exoskeleton was revealed through an official post on X (formerly Twitter). It was co-designed by Yoji Shinkawa, the art director from Kojima Productions, and the DNSYS team. The Dnsys Z1 Exoskeleton Pro is scheduled to release on December 2, 2025.

Similar to the game, the Death Stranding 2 Dnsys Z1 Exoskeleton Pro will help provide users with a mobility boost when traveling through complex terrains and environments. Users will experience a leg enhancement that provides 50% extra power to their steps. They will also receive an endurance boost, which increases their hiking range by 15.5 miles and vertical climbing by 9.3 miles.

The exoskeleton will provide knee pressure relief, with users able to offload ‚Äúup to 200%‚Äù of their body weight from the knees, and it also helps. Instantly feel up to 44‚ÄØlbs lighter during vertical movements. The device will provide ‚ÄúAI gait control across rugged trails, stairs, and slopes,‚Äù and users can look forward to ‚Äú4+ hours of continuous support, with quick-swap batteries.‚Äù

In other news, Hideo Kojima has written the concept for Death Stranding 3, but will not be making it.
